rComments: He's a nice guy but I felt like he didn't teach anything relevant. All we did was try to pronounce archaic sounds. The entire class seemed more like lessons about speech impediments. Every class was just a session of weird noises! The quizzes were hell since the content wasn't really ever covered in class. He's a Linguistics guy..not Lit!
angelo was amazing.  seriously, the best language professor i've ever had.  everything was clear, thorough, and fair.

Really nice guy, but most of the time he had no idea what he was doing. The reading was pointless because he goes over the exact same things in class, step by step. Some of the homework he assigned w/o even looking at what it was and ended up canceling it once he discovered no one knew how to do it. I'll never take another class with him.

His grades are based entirely on quizzes, which have almost nothing to do with readings, which have almost nothing to do with his horrid lectures which never seem to pertain to anything relevant. Instead of teaching us Linguistics, he shares with us his extensive knowledge of dead languages - not helpful, as the class is about English.

Angelo is a new teacher at UCSC, and he is the man. He has a great sense of humor about language, and is really able to pull the most important concepts out of the material. In some ways he oversimplifies things, but only because it's his first class and he is trying to make sure the class isn't overly difficult. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
